sources.title: The Brain Eaters
sources.description: This could be considered a rip off of "Invasion of the Body Snatchers" (1956) and Roger Corman's "It Conquered the World," except for something you will only discover by watching it, and it is worth watching. This is a surprisingly good little drive-in sci fi flick considering the extreme limitations of its $30,000 budget. Directed by Bruno VeSota. Released in 1958. a.k.a. "Keepers of the Earth" "The Keepers" "The Brain Snatchers" Complete print. CAST NOTES: Although Joanna Lee had a successful career as a screen writer and producer she is mostly remembered for her role as the alien, Tanna, in "Plan 9 From Outer Space." Leonard Nimoy is billed as Leonard Nemoy.

sources.title: The Brain Eaters (1958) Leonard Nimoy, Ed Nelson | Sci-Fi, Horror | Full Movie | Subtitled
sources.description:
Crawling, slimy things terror-bent on destroying the world! 
The inhabitants of a small Illinois town begin disappearing after a strange cone is found sticking out of the ground nearby.

Original title: The Brain Eaters (1958)

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/GC1tZmZjByg

Director: Bruno VeSota
Writer: Gordon Urquhart
Stars: Ed Nelson, Alan Jay Factor, Cornelius Keefe & Leonard Nimoy
Genres: Cult Classic, Sci-Fi, Horror
Budget: $30,000

metadata.Plot: Strange things are happening in Riverdale, Illinois. A huge, seemingly alien structure has been found jutting out of the earth. Sent to investigate the origin of the mysterious object, Senator Walter Powers discovers that parasites from the center of the earth have infiltrated the town, taking control of the authorities and workers, making communication with the outside world impossible, and leaving the responsibility of stopping the invasion up to Powers and a small group of free individuals.
metadata.Actors: Ed Nelson, Alan Jay Factor, Cornelius Keefe
